headline: Carer 'had sexual relationship with boy, 17, after wearing hot pants to work'
author: Sam Elliott-Gibbs
sentences:
The Social Care Wales panel heard Fitzpatrick, who worked for the Keys Childcare group, sent text messages to the boy saying “I love you.”
Presenting officer Graham Miles said the matter came to light when the youth damaged the car near the home.

A carer began a "sexual" relationship with a 17-year-old after wearing hot pants and a crop top to work in a children's residential home, a hearing was told.
A Fitness to Practise hearing was told one colleague felt Fitzpatrick wore the "inappropriate" clothing after seeing her in hot pants and a crop top.
Mr Miles said: “She failed to maintain appropriate professional boundaries and formed an inappropriate relationship which was sexually motivated."
The pair allegedly sparked a relationship together - and booked to go on a 200-mile trip from the home to Thorpe Park to stay in a hotel.
Fitzpatrick’s former partner Matthew Griffiths, who worked as a carer for another firm, also faces allegations of dishonest conduct.
Fitzpatrick, who was first registered as a carer in 2014, faces four allegations of failing to maintain a professional boundary.
A neighbour told a member of staff he had seen Fitzpatrick and the youth kissing and hugging several times, the hearing heard.
But concerns were raised about Fitzpatrick when the teenager damaged a car after becoming angry the trip had been called off.
The colleague also alleged they had seen the pair sitting with their legs draped across each other in Wrexham, North Wales.
Jade Fitzpatrick, 26, was reportedly spotted hugging and kissing the teenage boy who lived at the home where she worked.
The hearing was told she communicated with the teenager using a secret language which no-one else understood.
But he denies failing to take appropriate action by reporting his suspicions about Fitzpatrick.
He has admitted two allegations of lying and that his conduct was dishonest at the hearing.
